intro: Neoboykinia lycoctonifolia, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh desert conditions. Neoboykinia lycoctonifolia is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse range of species with unique botanical features.
